block.p: Rachel Layton, the daughter of Mrs. Richard Winn of Glenmoore, Pa., and Kirk Layton of Flourtown, Pa., was married yesterday to Ben Elwes, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Mark Elwes of Northwold, England. The Rev. Elsa Hale Mintz performed the ceremony at St. Andrew's Episcopal Church in Glenmoore. Msgr. Stephen Forish took part in the service.
Mrs. Elwes, 32, is the curator of the Gilbert Collection at Somerset House, an art museum in London. Mr. Elwes, 35, is a partner in Elwes & Hanham, dealers in old master paintings, also in London.

Rachel Layton, the daughter of Mrs. Richard Winn of Glenmoore, Pa., and Kirk Layton of Flourtown, Pa., was married yesterday to Ben Elwes, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Mark Elwes of Northwold, England. The Rev. Elsa Hale Mintz performed the ceremony at St. Andrew's Episcopal Church in Glenmoore. Msgr. Stephen Forish took part in the service.
Mrs. Elwes, 32, is the curator of the Gilbert Collection at Somerset House, an art museum in London. Mr. Elwes, 35, is a partner in Elwes & Hanham, dealers in old master paintings, also in London.

The bride graduated from Mount Holyoke College and was a McNeil fellow in the Winterthur program in early American culture at the University of Delaware. Her mother retired as the director of the W. Graham Arader III Gallery, a fine arts gallery in Philadelphia. Her father is the senior vice president for sales and marketing of the ICT Group, a marketing services company in Langhorne, Pa. Her stepfather, Richard Winn, is a real estate developer and investor in Glenmoore.
Mr. Elwes graduated from Newcastle University in England. His father is a direct-marketing consultant in Northwold.
